title: Drawing, "Damascus, Syria, Seen from the Northwest, Part 2", April or May 1868
medium: Grpahite, brush and white gouache on light paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite at various locations:  last / olives warm grey / poplars upright rich green / reddish; and again at lower right: 2d part / of sketch of / Damascus / from wely.
description: Horizontal view with a rock in the foreground, a group of houses in the left middle ground and a railway line in the background.  Broad margin at left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Damascus, Syria, Seen from the Northwest, Part 2", April or May 1868.
April or May 1868. Grpahite, brush and white gouache on light paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-158-b.
